content.text:
# 26th International Emmy Awards

}}
| location = New York Hilton MidtownNew York City
| host = Hans Liberg
| network =
| producer =
| previous = 25th
| main =
| next = 27th
}}
The 26th International Emmy Awards took place on November 23, 1998 in New York City and hosted by Dutch comedian Hans Liberg. The award ceremony, presented by the International Academy of Television Arts and Sciences (IATAS), honors all programming produced and originally aired outside the United States. Among the presenters were John Ritter, Alan Thicke, Linda Purl and Joanne Woodward.

!style:"width:50%"|Best Children & Young People Program

** Lorca: Centenary of a Poet - (Spain) (Canal Plus)
|valign="top"|
* 'Blabbermouth & Stickybeak - (Australia) (Channel Four)'
** Kids Can Do It! - (Japan) (NHK)
** Wise Up - (United Kingdom) (Carlton Prods.)
|-
!style:"width:50%"|Best Documentary
!style:"width:50%"|Best Drama

|valign="top"|

** Futebol - (Brazil) (GNT)
** Endgame: The Untold Story of the Hostage Crisis in Peru - (Japan) (NHK)
|valign="top"|
* 'The Tattooed Widow - (Sweden) (SVT)'
** White Lies - (Canada) (CBC)
** Das Urteil - (Germany) (NDR)

|valign="top"|
* 'The Vicar of Dibley - (United Kingdom) (BBC)'
** Goodness Gracious Me - (United Kingdom) (BBC)
